There are plenty of quality news outlets out ther… If all of us paid for quality content, would we be free of screaming, loud journalism? Would love to hear from people who know more..... This poison of negativity spreads through society,people realise that negativity gets noticed,talked about & so there is more of it. It becomes a scary spiral. Negativity is a silent epidemic that too needs a vaccine. Hopefully our young entrepreneurs & innovators aren't infected I get so enthused reading about start up and innovation awards. There is so much positive energy in India, so many young people with pride and ambition. And yet our media owners remain obsessed with poisonous ranting under the scary belief that what delivers numbers is good... The excitement is in the anticipation and the planning #Dream11IPL. Mist do it again #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha Live on #90sWithHarsha #90sNostalgia https://t.co/47JtEGSGcu Sorry guys, some tech issues. Getting there Going Live on #90sWithHarsha now #90sNostalgia 1.The Decade of Tendulkar.The confidence.The aggression.The youthfulness.The trust. In an India that was opening up,@sachin_rt stood for what was possible. Perth, Chennai, Auckland, World Cup 96, Capetown, Sharjah, Melbourne. Sachin became part of us. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 2. The World Cup quarter-final of 1996. The most tense, the most viewed event of its times. India didn't move from the TV screen. Prasad vs Sohail,Jadeja's onslaught,Sidhu's innings,calming Kumble. The high of the QF, the shattering low of the SF #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 3. A world record for Kapil Dev. We couldn't have dreamt an Indian fast bowler would stand atop the cricket world. @therealkapildev showed the way for the next generation by making the new ball a weapon. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 4. Pakistan tour of India in 1999. That great Chennai Test, @anilkumble1074 with the magical all ten in Delhi, full houses, tense cricket with some of the biggest names from both countries. India-Pakistan also played a lot of odi cricket in the 90s. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 5. TV rights were sold for the first time. Hero Cup was a legal battle & a cricketing event. The value in Indian cricket started getting unlocked. Professional TV prod came to India. Cricket grew beyond Doordarshan. ESPN, then Star Sports arrived. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 6. The spectre of match-fixing. Suspicion grew in our game, in whispers then more loudly, trust was injured. The second half was a low point,the darkness before the dawn. It passed too.  #90sNostalgia 90sWithHarsha 7. The arrival of @anilkumble1074, #Dravid, @SGanguly99, @vvslaxman281. First glimpse of @virendersehwag. Set the scene for a lot of joy in the next decade. The formative years were wonderful to watch. Leaves were sprouting, the flowers would bloom. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 8. India's historic tour of South Africa in 1992-93. ANC wasn't yet in power, India still had no diplomatic ties, no visas, we knew little about SA cricket and life there. Was a journey into the unknown. Pathbreaking tour, cricket wasn't great. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 9. Tigers at home, lambs overseas. Won/drew every home series, lost/drew every away series except Sri Lanka 1993. Tendulkar's first away win outside Asia was 12 years after debut. #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha 10. Advertisers like #Pepsi with #NothingOfficialAboutIt #YehDilMaangeMore and other slogans taking cricketers into non-cricket homes via entertainment and investing money into Indian cricket. Significant part of making Indian cricket rich.  #90sNostalgia #90sWithHarsha All set for a Twitter Live chat on #90sWithHarsha. Lots of questions. Much to chat. #90sNostalgia .
